byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria, and Neil MacFarquhar from the United Nations.

abstract: Navi Pillay, United Nations high commissioner for human rights, , puts the onus on all members of the international community to protect Syrian civilians from a brutal military crackdown by the government of Pres Bashar al-Assad; Pillay stops short, however, of calling for military intervention.
snippet: Navi Pillay, the United Nations high commissioner for human rights, called for protection for Syrian civilians, but stopped short of urging military intervention.

lead_paragraph: Navi Pillay, the United Nations high commissioner for human rights, called for protection for Syrian civilians, but stopped short of urging military intervention.

headline.main: U.N. Official Urges World to Stand Up for Syrians
headline.print_headline: U.N. Official Urges World To Stand Up For Syrians
headline.seo: Navi Pillay of the U.N. Calls for Action on Syria
